subject: Leadership
title: The Art of Listening
description: A quick, practical guide to The Art of Listening.

hook.text: A leader asks for feedback in a meeting. While someone answers, he checks his phone. The team stops sharing ideas.

buildup.text: Listening is the most undervalued leadership skill. Most leaders hear words but miss meaning. There's a difference.

discovery.text: Active listening means full attention, zero judgment, and reflecting back what you heard. Not waiting for your turn.

twist.text: Leaders who listen learn what surveys can't reveal: real fears, hidden conflicts, and ideas people won't put on paper.

climax.text: In your next one-on-one, listen for two minutes without interrupting. Summarize what you heard. Watch trust grow.

punchline.text: The best leaders speak last and listen first.

quiz.question: What is active listening?
options: Full attention, no judgment, reflecting back
Preparing your response while someone talks
